reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This works very well on my Fire
reviews.reviewText: Recently got access to the virtual PC pilot at work, including external connectivity.Saw the VMware View client was available for the Kindle and decided to give it a try.Works every bit as well as the Citrix equivalent and has the same limitations: the 7" screen on the Fire is just a bit small for some things. This isn't the fault of the app, just the nature of the little screen.However, if you set up most of the things you want/need when you're connected to via a full-sized system, then usage while on the Kindle is quite satisfying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2012
reviews.reviewText: I agree with the other reviewer who said the app needs a save password option. That being said I realize leaving it out is more a security feature than a lack of functionality so I still gave 5 stars. Vmware is an industry leader in virtualization and after using this free app, it is easy to see why. The Kindle Fire version is responsive and easy to use. If you have a Kindle Fire and connect to a Vmware View server for your desktop access, there is absolutely no reason not to use this excellent client app.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't work; no documentations.
reviews.reviewText: I was unable to get this app to work. It couldn't find my desktop even when I was sitting at it. There was no documentation for me to refer to in order to see if I was doing something wrong. As a result, I uninstalled it.No much else to say since I couldn't get it to work. Would NOT recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars works well on my Kindle FIRE
reviews.reviewText: ta-da! It works! I have to use this app to access my work computer desktop (I'm in I.T. at a local hospital). This mobile app works just as well on my FIRE as the similar one does on my home desktop PC, although I prefer to use it on the PC rather than my FIRE. However, it will give me access when I'm out of town.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The program is great but when using it via my device some times ...
reviews.reviewText: The program is great but when using it via my device some times it doesn't work. I still like it because i can access my site.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019
reviews.reviewText: I had to get this app for a step in the process of getting a second level access to my job as a remote employee. Basically, I downloaded the app, and my IT department had to walk me through the process with it. And it's something I only needed to use one time, so I'm not really sure if it should even be part of the review process. I guess if people are able to use it for personal reasons???

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars It Won't Download - And Then It Did Download
reviews.reviewText: It will not even download to my Kindle Fire. I click the download button, it appears to start downloading, and within 2 seconds it exits the App Store and sends me back to my Apps library. Ugh. I need this to be able to work. Very frustrating. UPDATE: After trying several times the app finally downloaded (seems I needed to have a bad review post before it would download?). However, on both my Kindle Fire and my android phone there are still issues: I'm never able to connect fully. I'll have to troubleshoot this with the organization I'm trying to connect with to see if it's the app or the organization. Still very frustrating. I'd hoped this would work seamlessly to reach a VDI desktop.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Works alright as a client, but does not adapt ...
reviews.reviewText: Works alright as a client, but does not adapt well to different screen sizes. Scrolling up and down is difficult.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 4, 2019
reviews.reviewText: This works as I was hoping it would. The set up was straightforward. It means I can connect to my works computer and hard drive using my Kindle Fire and open Word, e.g., makes changes and save.

reviews.reviewTitle: Androidでも同じように使えます
reviews.reviewText: WindowsPCでできることはできますBTマウスとキーボードつけてWindowsPCと同じように使っています
Works great on Blackberry z30 tks

Je rectifie mon avis car j'ai réussi à faire fonctionner l'appli sur mon BlackBerry Passport. La taille de l'écran carré donne une réelle utilité à cet outil qui dans ce cas est plus proche de la tablette. De plus le clavier physique du Blackberry rend les saisies beaucoup plus simples
